attributes.overallObjectives: Students will explore the development of human civilization from prehistoric times through the fall of major ancient empires. Through archaeological evidence, historical texts, and cultural analysis, students will understand the interconnections between different societies and their lasting impact on modern civilization. The course emphasizes critical thinking about historical sources and understanding patterns of social development.
classObjectives: Week 1 | Early Human Societies: Examine the transition from hunter-gatherer to agricultural communities
Week 2 | Mesopotamian Civilizations: Study the rise of city-states and early writing systems
Week 3 | Ancient Egypt: Analyze the role of the Nile and development of complex society
Week 4 | Bronze Age Cultures: Compare Mediterranean and Asian bronze age societies
Week 5 | Classical Greece: Explore democracy, philosophy, and cultural achievements
Week 6 | Roman Empire: Study political systems and cultural assimilation
Week 7 | Ancient Americas: Examine Mayan and Incan civilizations
Week 8 | Final Project: Create comparative analysis of ancient civilizations
